form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tester (for himself, Mr. Blumenthal, and Mr. Baucus) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To allow members of the Armed Forces and National Guard to defer principal on Federal student loans for a certain period in connection with receipt of orders for mobilization for war or national emergency, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Service Members Student Loan Relief Act.

section.header: Deferral for certain period in connection with receipt of orders for mobilization for war or national emergency

subsection.text: Section 428(b)(1)(M) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1078(b)(1)(M)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking , during any period;
in clause (iii)—

subparagraph.text: by striking during which and inserting during any period during which; and

paragraph.text: by redesignating clause (iv) as clause (vi);
by inserting after clause (iii) the following:

clause.text: in the case of any borrower who has received a call or order to duty described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (iii), during the shorter of—

subclause.text: the period beginning on the date such call or order to duty is received by the borrower and ending on the first day of the service described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (iii); and
the 180-day period preceding the first day of such service;

in the case of any borrower described in such clause whose call or order to duty is cancelled before the first day of the service described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (iii) because of a personal injury in connection with training to prepare for such service, during the period described in clause (iv) and during an additional period equal to the duration of such service, as specified by or otherwise determined in the original call or order to duty; and

in the case of any borrower whose call or order to duty is cancelled before the first day of such service for a reason other than an injury described in subclause (I), during the period beginning on the date the call or order to duty is received by the borrower and ending on the date that is 14 days after such call or order to duty is cancelled; and

paragraph.text: in clause (vi) (as redesignated by paragraph (5)), by striking not in excess and inserting during any period not in excess.

subsection.text: Section 455(f)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087e(f)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C)—

subparagraph.text: by striking during which and inserting during any period during which; and

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraph (D) as subparagraph (F);
by inserting after subparagraph (C) the following:

subparagraph.text: in the case of any borrower who has received a call or order to duty described in clause (i) or (ii) of subparagraph (C), during the shorter of—

clause.text: the period beginning on the date such call or order to duty is received by the borrower and ending on the first day of the service described in clause (i) or (ii) of subparagraph (C); and
the 180-day period preceding the first day of such service;

in the case of any borrower described in such subparagraph whose call or order to duty is cancelled before the first day of the service described in clause (i) or (ii) of subparagraph (C) because of a personal injury in connection with training to prepare for such service, during the period described in subparagraph (D) and during an additional period equal to the duration of such service, as specified by or otherwise determined in the original call or order to duty; and

in the case of any borrower whose call or order to duty is cancelled before the first day of such service for a reason other than an injury described in clause (i), during the period beginning on the date the call or order to duty is received by the borrower and ending on the date that is 14 days after such call or order to duty is cancelled; and

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (F) (as redesignated by paragraph (5)), by striking not in excess and inserting during any period not in excess.

subsection.text: Section 464(c)(2)(A) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087dd(c)(2)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking during any period;
by redesignating clauses (iv) and (v) as clauses (vi) and (vii), respectively;
by inserting after clause (iii) the following:

clause.text: in the case of any borrower who has received a call or order to duty described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (iii), during the shorter of—

subclause.text: the period beginning on the date such call or order to duty is received by the borrower and ending on the first day of the service described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (iii); and
the 180-day period preceding the first day of such service;

in the case of any borrower described in such clause whose call or order to duty is cancelled before the first day of the service described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (iii) because of a personal injury in connection with training to prepare for such service, during the period described in clause (iv) and during an additional period equal to the duration of such service, as specified by or otherwise determined in the original call or order to duty; and

in the case of any borrower whose call or order to duty is cancelled before the first day of such service for a reason other than an injury described in subclause (I), during the period beginning on the date the call or order to duty is received by the borrower and ending on the date that is 14 days after such call or order to duty is cancelled;

paragraph.text: in clause (vi) (as redesignated by paragraph (5)), by striking not in excess and inserting during any period not in excess; and
in clause (vii) (as redesignated by paragraph (5)), by striking during which and inserting during any period during which.

subsection.text: Nothing in the amendments made by this section shall be construed to authorize any refunding of any repayment of a loan.
The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to all loans made, insured, or guaranteed under title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070 et seq.).

section.text: Title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070 et seq.) is further amended—

paragraph.text: in section 428B(d)(1)(A)(ii) (20 U.S.C. 1078–2(d)(1)(A)(ii)), by striking 428(b)(1)(M)(i)(I) and inserting or clause (i)(I), (iv), or (v) of section 428(b)(1)(M); and

in section 493D(a) (20 U.S.C. 1098f(a)), by striking section 428(b)(1)(M)(iii), 455(f)(2)(C), or 464(c)(2)(A)(iii) and inserting clause (iii) or (iv) of section 428(b)(1)(M), subparagraph (C) or (D) of section 455(f)(2), or clause (iii) or (iv) of section 464(c)(2)(A).
